snippet: Scientists say they simply do not know for sure if Hurricane Sandy was caused or made worse by human-induced global warming.
abstract: Climate scientists say they cannot know for sure if Hurricane Sandy was caused or made worse by human-induced global warming, but that the resulting storm surge along the Atlantic coast was almost certainly intensified by decades of sea-level rise linked to greenhouse gas emissions; emphasize that regardless, event should be seen as a portent of trouble as seas rise faster, risks of climate change accumulate and political system fails to respond.
lead_paragraph: Scientists say they simply do not know for sure if Hurricane Sandy was caused or made worse by human-induced global warming.

headline.seo: Scientists Unsure if Climate Change Is to Blame for Hurricane Sandy
headline.main: Are Humans to Blame? Science Is Out
headline.print_headline: Are Humans to Blame? Science Is Out
